segment.source: Audit Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings security policy setting.

segment.source: Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings
segment.target: Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings security policy setting.

segment.source: You can manage your audit policy in a more precise way by using audit policy subcategories.
segment.target: You can manage your audit policy in a more precise way by using audit policy subcategories.

segment.source: There are over 40 auditing subcategories that provide precise details about activities on a device.
segment.target: There are over 40 auditing subcategories that provide precise details about activities on a device.

segment.source: For info about these subcategories, see the Advanced security audit policy settings.
segment.target: For info about these subcategories, see the Advanced security audit policy settings.

segment.source: This provides the ability to audit events at the category level without revising a policy.
segment.target: This provides the ability to audit events at the category level without revising a policy.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.
segment.target: All auditing capabilities are integrated in Group Policy.

segment.source: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).
segment.target: You can configure, deploy, and manage these settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or Local Security Policy snap-in for a domain, site, or organizational unit (OU).

segment.source: To manage an audit policy by using subcategories without requiring a change to Group Policy, the SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy registry value , prevents the application of category-level audit policy from Group Policy and from the Local Security Policy administrative tool.
segment.target: To manage an audit policy by using subcategories without requiring a change to Group Policy, the SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy registry value , prevents the application of category-level audit policy from Group Policy and from the Local Security Policy administrative tool.

segment.source: If the category level audit policy that is set here is not consistent with the events that are currently being generated, the cause might be that this registry key is set.
segment.target: If the category level audit policy that is set here is not consistent with the events that are currently being generated, the cause might be that this registry key is set.

segment.source: You can use auditpol.exe to display and manage audit policies from a command prompt.
segment.target: You can use auditpol.exe to display and manage audit policies from a command prompt.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Prior to the introduction of auditing subcategories in Windows Vista, it was difficult to track events at a per-system or per-user level.
segment.target: Prior to the introduction of auditing subcategories in Windows Vista, it was difficult to track events at a per-system or per-user level.

segment.source: The larger event categories created too many events, and the key information that needed to be audited was difficult to find.
segment.target: The larger event categories created too many events, and the key information that needed to be audited was difficult to find.

segment.source: Enable audit policy subcategories as needed to track specific events.
segment.target: Enable audit policy subcategories as needed to track specific events.

segment.source: If you attempt to modify an audit setting by using Group Policy after enabling this setting through the command-line tools, the Group Policy audit setting is ignored in favor of the custom policy setting.
segment.target: If you attempt to modify an audit setting by using Group Policy after enabling this setting through the command-line tools, the Group Policy audit setting is ignored in favor of the custom policy setting.

segment.source: To modify audit settings by using Group Policy, you must first disable the SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy key.
segment.target: To modify audit settings by using Group Policy, you must first disable the SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy key.

segment.source: Important: Be very cautious about audit settings that can generate a large volume of traffic.
segment.target: Important: Be very cautious about audit settings that can generate a large volume of traffic.

segment.source: For example, if you enable success or failure auditing for all of the Privilege Use subcategories, the high volume of audit events that are generated can make it difficult to find other types of entries in the security event log.
segment.target: For example, if you enable success or failure auditing for all of the Privilege Use subcategories, the high volume of audit events that are generated can make it difficult to find other types of entries in the security event log.

segment.source: Such a configuration could also have a significant impact on system performance.
segment.target: Such a configuration could also have a significant impact on system performance.
